summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the commencement of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial on November 29, 2021. It details the location, COVID-19 protocols, and public/press access arrangements for the trial at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse in New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose trial is set to commence on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order detailing trial logistics and access protocols.

events.title: Commencement of Ghislaine Maxwell's Trial
events.description: The criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin.

locations: Courtroom 318, United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal trial is set to commence on November 29, 2021.
The trial will be held in Courtroom 318 at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse in New York.
The court order establishes specific COVID-19 protocols for public and press access, including health screenings and mask requirements.
The order references prior directives to ensure access for alleged victims and members of the defendant's family.
Broadcasting of the proceedings from the courtroom is prohibited, but live video/audio feeds will be available in overflow rooms.
